meanings.definition: A very successful and profitable movie, book, or other product.
meanings.sent1: The new superhero movie was a blockbust at the box office.
meanings.sent2: The author's latest novel became a blockbust among young readers.
meanings.sent3: The comedy film was such a blockbust that everyone in the theater was laughing non-stop.
meanings.sent4: Her business idea was a blockbust, bringing in more customers than she ever imagined.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's signature dish was a blockbust, with customers coming back for more every day.

meanings.definition: To achieve great success or popularity.
meanings.sent1: The singer hoped to blockbust in the music industry with her new album.
meanings.sent2: After years of hard work, the startup finally began to blockbust in the market.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to make a rabbit disappear seemed to blockbust with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's dedication and training helped him blockbust in his sport.
meanings.sent5: The student's innovative project started to blockbust among his classmates.

meanings.definition: To demolish or destroy something, especially a building.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew had to blockbust the old building to make room for the new skyscraper.
meanings.sent2: The tornado's strong winds threatened to blockbust the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The kids' pillow fight accidentally caused a blockbust of feathers in the room.
meanings.sent4: The demolition team carefully planned how to blockbust the condemned structure.
meanings.sent5: The wrecking ball was used to blockbust the abandoned factory.
